articles.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise cancelation models
articles.description: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.content: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone

articles.title: Build a multimodal generative AI assistant for root cause diagnosis in predictive maintenance using Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.
articles.author: Carla Lorente
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.

articles.title: Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents
articles.description: Recursive Language Models aim to break the usual trade off between context length, accuracy and cost in large language models. Instead of forcing a model to read a giant prompt in one pass, RLMs treat the prompt as an external environment and let the model decide how to inspect it with code, then recursively call […] The post Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents appeared first on MarkTechPost.
articles.author: Asif Razzaq
articles.content: Recursive Language Models aim to break the usual trade off between context length, accuracy and cost in large language models. Instead of forcing a model to read a giant prompt in one pass, RLMs treat the prompt as an external environment and let the model decide how to inspect it with code, then recursively call […] The post Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents appeared first on MarkTechPost.

articles.title: Programmatically creating an IDP solution with Amazon Bedrock Data Automation
articles.description: In this post, we explore how to programmatically create an IDP solution that uses Strands SDK, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base, and Bedrock Data Automation (BDA). This solution is provided through a Jupyter notebook that enables users to upload multi-modal business documents and extract insights using BDA as a parser to retrieve relevant chunks and augment a prompt to a foundational model (FM).
articles.author: Raian Osman
articles.content: In this post, we explore how to programmatically create an IDP solution that uses Strands SDK, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Base, and Bedrock Data Automation (BDA). This solution is provided through a Jupyter notebook that enables users to upload multi-modal business documents and extract insights using BDA as a parser to retrieve relevant chunks and augment a prompt to a foundational model (FM).

articles.title: Advancing ADHD diagnosis: How Qbtech built a mobile AI assessment Model Using Amazon SageMaker AI
articles.description: In this post, we explore how Qbtech streamlined their machine learning (ML) workflow using Amazon SageMaker AI, a fully managed service to build, train and deploy ML models, and AWS Glue, a serverless service that makes data integration simpler, faster, and more cost effective. This new solution reduced their feature engineering time from weeks to hours, while maintaining the high clinical standards required by healthcare providers.
articles.author: Antonio Martellotta
articles.content: In this post, we explore how Qbtech streamlined their machine learning (ML) workflow using Amazon SageMaker AI, a fully managed service to build, train and deploy ML models, and AWS Glue, a serverless service that makes data integration simpler, faster, and more cost effective. This new solution reduced their feature engineering time from weeks to hours, while maintaining the high clinical standards required by healthcare providers.

articles.title: Lemon Slice launches with $10.5M seed round to scale real-time interactive AI avatars
articles.description: Frontier artificial intelligence research and product startup Lemon Slice launched today and announced that it had raised $10.5 million in funding. The money will be used to scale up its real-time interactive avatar technology and drive broader commercial adoption of its application programming interface and embedded avatar products. articles.title: Move Beyond Chain-of-Thought with Chain-of-Draft on Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: This post explores Chain-of-Draft (CoD), an innovative prompting technique introduced in a Zoom AI Research paper Chain of Draft: Thinking Faster by Writing Less, that revolutionizes how models approach reasoning tasks. While Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting has been the go-to method for enhancing model reasoning, CoD offers a more efficient alternative that mirrors human problem-solving patterns—using concise, high-signal thinking steps rather than verbose explanations.
articles.author: Ahmed Raafat
articles.content: This post explores Chain-of-Draft (CoD), an innovative prompting technique introduced in a Zoom AI Research paper Chain of Draft: Thinking Faster by Writing Less, that revolutionizes how models approach reasoning tasks. While Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting has been the go-to method for enhancing model reasoning, CoD offers a more efficient alternative that mirrors human problem-solving patterns—using concise, high-signal thinking steps rather than verbose explanations.

articles.title: Glean’s Work AI Institute identifies 5 core AI tensions
articles.description: Global leaders are grappling with five core tensions as artificial intelligence (AI) integrates into workplaces, according to insights from over 100 builders, executives, investors, advisors, and researchers. These tensions encompass the relationship between experts and novices, centralization versus decentralization in governance, the impact of AI on hierarchical structures, the balance between speed and deliberate implementation, […]

articles.title: Meet LLMRouter: An Intelligent Routing System designed to Optimize LLM Inference by Dynamically Selecting the most Suitable Model for Each Query
articles.description: LLMRouter is an open source routing library from the U Lab at the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign that treats model selection as a first class system problem. It sits between applications and a pool of LLMs and chooses a model for each query based on task complexity, quality targets, and cost, all exposed through […] The post Meet LLMRouter: An Intelligent Routing System designed to Optimize LLM Inference by Dynamically Selecting the most Suitable Model for Each Query appeared first on...

articles.title: NIH-led study reveals role of mobile DNA elements in lung cancer progression
articles.description: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.
articles.content: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.

articles.title: Migrate MLflow tracking servers to Amazon SageMaker AI with serverless MLflow
articles.description: This post shows you how to migrate your self-managed MLflow tracking server to a MLflow App – a serverless tracking server on SageMaker AI that automatically scales resources based on demand while removing server patching and storage management tasks at no cost. Learn how to use the MLflow Export Import tool to transfer your experiments, runs, models, and other MLflow resources, including instructions to validate your migration's success.
articles.author: Rahul Easwar
articles.content: This post shows you how to migrate your self-managed MLflow tracking server to a MLflow App – a serverless tracking server on SageMaker AI that automatically scales resources based on demand while removing server patching and storage management tasks at no cost. Learn how to use the MLflow Export Import tool to transfer your experiments, runs, models, and other MLflow resources, including instructions to validate your migration's success.

articles.title: Airloom to showcase roller coaster style wind turbines at CES 2026
articles.description: Airloom is set to showcase its innovative wind power technology at CES 2026, positioning it as a sustainable solution for the surging energy demands of AI data centers. Unlike traditional massive turbines, Airloom’s design utilizes a 20-to-30-meter high track system where adjustable wings circulate like a roller coaster to generate electricity. This approach reportedly requires […]
